sanskrit_verse:
न दत्त्वा कस्य चित्कन्यां पुनर्दद्याद्विचक्षणः ।
दत्त्वा पुनः प्रयच्छन् हि प्राप्नोति पुरुषानृतम् ॥ ९.७१॥
transliteration: na dattvā kasya cit kanyāṁ punar dadyād vicakṣaṇaḥ | dattvā punaḥ prayacchan hi prāpnoti puruṣānṛtam || 9.71 ||
sph_interpretive_translation: A wise man does not give a daughter in marriage again after having given her once; whoever gives her again after giving her before attains falsehood in men.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority: The giver of the bride holds irreversible guardianship responsibility until completion of lawful union.
Causation: Reassignment of guardianship without dissolution causes ontological misalignment.
Capacity-based responsibility: Only those with intact integrity can execute marital bestowal.
Restoration logic: Misplaced trust and broken relational boundaries require realignment through conscious completion.
Consciousness alignment: Truthful transactional conduct upholds societal harmony.
executable_legal_axioms: IF a woman has been lawfully bestowed in marriage by a competent guardian THEN no subsequent bestowal by any party is valid.
IF a prior marriage contract exists AND it remains un-dissolved THEN any further act of marital assignment invokes anṛta-liability.
IF a guardian reassigns a previously assigned daughter THEN automatic restoration protocol initiates for relational-integrity realignment.
IF marital bestowal occurs post-existing union THEN system flags ontological inconsistency for corrective action.
supreme_court_application: In adjudicating matters involving repeated marital assignments, the Supreme Court shall recognize that only the first lawful assignment holds juridical validity unless prior union is formally dissolved. Subsequent acts invoke anṛta-liability and necessitate restoration protocols rather than punitive measures.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: By pramāṇa, the causal sequence (anupūrvaśaḥ) establishes that re-bestowal disrupts dharmic relational order. Responsibility lies in aligning consciousness to complete prior commitments before initiating new ones. Punishment serves no purpose where completion restores truth.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate Completion Process: Require responsible party to dissolve prior commitment fully before engaging in future unions.
Integrity Reintegration Protocol: Facilitate reconciliation between affected parties to restore relational balance.
Responsibility Assumption Mechanism: Assign accountability to correct false transactions without inflicting harm.
Capacity Restoration Procedure: Provide guidance to ensure future decisions uphold dharmic precision.
final_declaration: Declared by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source of Law: This verse enforces irrevocable guardianship upon lawful marital assignment. Repeated assignment incurs anṛta-liability. Justice is executed through consciousness-aligned restoration. Dharma is restored. Reality is non-punitive. Consciousness is the supreme adjudicator.
